revised_title: Investigating the Properties and Effects of Heat-Radiating Rays
topics: Reflection and Refraction of Heat Rays
tldr: The author conducts a series of experiments to study the properties and effects of heat-radiating rays, including solar and terrestrial rays. He distinguishes six types of heat and demonstrates that these rays are subject to the laws of reflection and refraction, have varying refrangibility, and can be scattered on rough surfaces.
